58  /**
59   * Maintains lists of permission grants to users and groups to allow for
60   * authorization checks by {@link AccessController}.
61   *
62   * <p>
63   * Access control lists are stored in an "internal" metadata table named
64   * {@code _acl_}. Each table's permission grants are stored as a separate row,
65   * keyed by the table name. KeyValues for permissions assignments are stored
66   * in one of the formats:
67   * <pre>
68   * Key                      Desc
69   * --------                 --------
70   * user                     table level permissions for a user [R=read, W=write]
71   * @group                   table level permissions for a group
72   * user,family              column family level permissions for a user
73   * @group,family            column family level permissions for a group
74   * user,family,qualifier    column qualifier level permissions for a user
75   * @group,family,qualifier  column qualifier level permissions for a group
76   * </pre>
77   * All values are encoded as byte arrays containing the codes from the
78   * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.access.TablePermission.Action} enum.
79   * </p>
80   */
81  public class AccessControlLists {
82    /** Internal storage table for access control lists */
83    public static final String ACL_TABLE_NAME_STR = "_acl_";
84    public static final byte[] ACL_TABLE_NAME = Bytes.toBytes(ACL_TABLE_NAME_STR);
85    public static final byte[] ACL_GLOBAL_NAME = ACL_TABLE_NAME;
86    /** Column family used to store ACL grants */
87    public static final String ACL_LIST_FAMILY_STR = "l";
88    public static final byte[] ACL_LIST_FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes(ACL_LIST_FAMILY_STR);
89  
90    /** Table descriptor for ACL internal table */
91    public static final HTableDescriptor ACL_TABLEDESC = new HTableDescriptor(
92        ACL_TABLE_NAME);
93    static {
94      ACL_TABLEDESC.addFamily(
95          new HColumnDescriptor(ACL_LIST_FAMILY,
96              10, // Ten is arbitrary number.  Keep versions to help debugging.
97              Compression.Algorithm.NONE.getName(), true, true, 8 * 1024,
98              HConstants.FOREVER, StoreFile.BloomType.NONE.toString(),
99              HConstants.REPLICATION_SCOPE_LOCAL));
100   }
101 
102   /**
103    * Delimiter to separate user, column family, and qualifier in
104    * _acl_ table info: column keys */
105   public static final char ACL_KEY_DELIMITER = ',';
106   /** Prefix character to denote group names */
107   public static final String GROUP_PREFIX = "@";
108   /** Configuration key for superusers */
109   public static final String SUPERUSER_CONF_KEY = "hbase.superuser";

111   private static Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(AccessControlLists.class);

113   /**
114    * Check for existence of {@code _acl_} table and create it if it does not exist
115    * @param master reference to HMaster
116    */
117   static void init(MasterServices master) throws IOException {
118     if (!MetaReader.tableExists(master.getCatalogTracker(), ACL_TABLE_NAME_STR)) {
119       master.createTable(ACL_TABLEDESC, null);
120     }
121   }

123   /**
124    * Stores a new user permission grant in the access control lists table.
125    * @param conf the configuration
126    * @param userPerm the details of the permission to be granted
127    * @throws IOException in the case of an error accessing the metadata table
128    */
129   static void addUserPermission(Configuration conf, UserPermission userPerm)
130       throws IOException {
131     Permission.Action[] actions = userPerm.getActions();
132 
133     Put p = new Put(userPerm.isGlobal() ? ACL_GLOBAL_NAME : userPerm.getTable());
134     byte[] key = userPermissionKey(userPerm);
135 
136     if ((actions == null) || (actions.length == 0)) {
137       String msg = "No actions associated with user '" + Bytes.toString(userPerm.getUser()) + "'";
138       LOG.warn(msg);
139       throw new IOException(msg);
140     }
141 
142     byte[] value = new byte[actions.length];
143     for (int i = 0; i < actions.length; i++) {
144       value[i] = actions[i].code();
145     }
146     p.add(ACL_LIST_FAMILY, key, value);
147     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
148       LOG.debug("Writing permission for table "+
149           Bytes.toString(userPerm.getTable())+" "+
150           Bytes.toString(key)+": "+Bytes.toStringBinary(value)
151       );
152     }
153     HTable acls = null;
154     try {
155       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
156       acls.put(p);
157     } finally {
158       if (acls != null) acls.close();
159     }
160   }
161 
162   /**
163    * Removes a previously granted permission from the stored access control
164    * lists.  The {@link TablePermission} being removed must exactly match what
165    * is stored -- no wildcard matching is attempted.  Ie, if user "bob" has
166    * been granted "READ" access to the "data" table, but only to column family
167    * plus qualifier "info:colA", then trying to call this method with only
168    * user "bob" and the table name "data" (but without specifying the
169    * column qualifier "info:colA") will have no effect.
170    *
171    * @param conf the configuration
172    * @param userPerm the details of the permission to be revoked
173    * @throws IOException if there is an error accessing the metadata table
174    */
175   static void removeUserPermission(Configuration conf, UserPermission userPerm)
176       throws IOException {
177 
178     Delete d = new Delete(userPerm.isGlobal() ? ACL_GLOBAL_NAME : userPerm.getTable());
179     byte[] key = userPermissionKey(userPerm);
180 
181     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
182       LOG.debug("Removing permission "+ userPerm.toString());
183     }
184     d.deleteColumns(ACL_LIST_FAMILY, key);
185     HTable acls = null;
186     try {
187       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
188       acls.delete(d);
189     } finally {
190       if (acls != null) acls.close();
191     }
192   }
193 
194   /**
195    * Remove specified table from the _acl_ table.
196    */
197   static void removeTablePermissions(Configuration conf, byte[] tableName)
198       throws IOException{
199     Delete d = new Delete(tableName);
200 
201     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
202       LOG.debug("Removing permissions of removed table "+ Bytes.toString(tableName));
203     }
204 
205     HTable acls = null;
206     try {
207       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
208       acls.delete(d);
209     } finally {
210       if (acls != null) acls.close();
211     }
212   }

214   /**
215    * Remove specified table column from the _acl_ table.
216    */
217   static void removeTablePermissions(Configuration conf, byte[] tableName, byte[] column)
218       throws IOException{
219 
220     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
221       LOG.debug("Removing permissions of removed column " + Bytes.toString(column) +
222                 " from table "+ Bytes.toString(tableName));
223     }
224 
225     HTable acls = null;
226     try {
227       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
228 
229       Scan scan = new Scan();
230       scan.addFamily(ACL_LIST_FAMILY);
231 
232       String columnName = Bytes.toString(column);
233       scan.setFilter(new QualifierFilter(CompareOp.EQUAL, new RegexStringComparator(
234                      String.format("(%s%s%s)|(%s%s)$",
235                      ACL_KEY_DELIMITER, columnName, ACL_KEY_DELIMITER,
236                      ACL_KEY_DELIMITER, columnName))));
237 
238       Set<byte[]> qualifierSet = new TreeSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
239       ResultScanner scanner = acls.getScanner(scan);
240       try {
241         for (Result res : scanner) {
242           for (byte[] q : res.getFamilyMap(ACL_LIST_FAMILY).navigableKeySet()) {
243             qualifierSet.add(q);
244           }
245         }
246       } finally {
247         scanner.close();
248       }
249 
250       if (qualifierSet.size() > 0) {
251         Delete d = new Delete(tableName);
252         for (byte[] qualifier : qualifierSet) {
253           d.deleteColumns(ACL_LIST_FAMILY, qualifier);
254         }
255         acls.delete(d);
256       }
257     } finally {
258       if (acls != null) acls.close();
259     }
260   }
261 
262   /**
263    * Build qualifier key from user permission:
264    *  username
265    *  username,family
266    *  username,family,qualifier
267    */
268   static byte[] userPermissionKey(UserPermission userPerm) {
269     byte[] qualifier = userPerm.getQualifier();
270     byte[] family = userPerm.getFamily();
271     byte[] key = userPerm.getUser();
272 
273     if (family != null && family.length > 0) {
274       key = Bytes.add(key, Bytes.add(new byte[]{ACL_KEY_DELIMITER}, family));
275       if (qualifier != null && qualifier.length > 0) {
276         key = Bytes.add(key, Bytes.add(new byte[]{ACL_KEY_DELIMITER}, qualifier));
277       }
278     }
279 
280     return key;
281   }

283   /**
284    * Returns {@code true} if the given region is part of the {@code _acl_}
285    * metadata table.
286    */
287   static boolean isAclRegion(HRegion region) {
288     return Bytes.equals(ACL_TABLE_NAME, region.getTableDesc().getName());
289   }
290 
291   /**
292    * Returns {@code true} if the given table is {@code _acl_} metadata table.
293    */
294   static boolean isAclTable(HTableDescriptor desc) {
295     return Bytes.equals(ACL_TABLE_NAME, desc.getName());
296   }

298   /**
299    * Loads all of the permission grants stored in a region of the {@code _acl_}
300    * table.
301    *
302    * @param aclRegion
303    * @return
304    * @throws IOException
305    */
306   static Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> loadAll(
307       HRegion aclRegion)
308     throws IOException {
309 
310     if (!isAclRegion(aclRegion)) {
311       throw new IOException("Can only load permissions from "+ACL_TABLE_NAME_STR);
312     }
313 
314     Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> allPerms =
315         new TreeMap<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
316     
317     // do a full scan of _acl_ table
318 
319     Scan scan = new Scan();
320     scan.addFamily(ACL_LIST_FAMILY);
321 
322     InternalScanner iScanner = null;
323     try {
324       iScanner = aclRegion.getScanner(scan);
325 
326       while (true) {
327         List<KeyValue> row = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
328 
329         boolean hasNext = iScanner.next(row);
330         ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms = ArrayListMultimap.create();
331         byte[] table = null;
332         for (KeyValue kv : row) {
333           if (table == null) {
334             table = kv.getRow();
335           }
336           Pair<String,TablePermission> permissionsOfUserOnTable =
337               parseTablePermissionRecord(table, kv);
338           if (permissionsOfUserOnTable != null) {
339             String username = permissionsOfUserOnTable.getFirst();
340             TablePermission permissions = permissionsOfUserOnTable.getSecond();
341             perms.put(username, permissions);
342           }
343         }
344         if (table != null) {
345           allPerms.put(table, perms);
346         }
347         if (!hasNext) {
348           break;
349         }
350       }
351     } finally {
352       if (iScanner != null) {
353         iScanner.close();
354       }
355     }
356 
357     return allPerms;
358   }
359 
360   /**
361    * Load all permissions from the region server holding {@code _acl_},
362    * primarily intended for testing purposes.
363    */
364   static Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> loadAll(
365       Configuration conf) throws IOException {
366     Map<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>> allPerms =
367         new TreeMap<byte[],ListMultimap<String,TablePermission>>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
368 
369     // do a full scan of _acl_, filtering on only first table region rows
370 
371     Scan scan = new Scan();
372     scan.addFamily(ACL_LIST_FAMILY);
373 
374     HTable acls = null;
375     ResultScanner scanner = null;
376     try {
377       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
378       scanner = acls.getScanner(scan);
379       for (Result row : scanner) {
380         ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> resultPerms =
381             parseTablePermissions(row.getRow(), row);
382         allPerms.put(row.getRow(), resultPerms);
383       }
384     } finally {
385       if (scanner != null) scanner.close();
386       if (acls != null) acls.close();
387     }
388 
389     return allPerms;
390   }

392   /**
393    * Reads user permission assignments stored in the <code>l:</code> column
394    * family of the first table row in <code>_acl_</code>.
395    *
396    * <p>
397    * See {@link AccessControlLists class documentation} for the key structure
398    * used for storage.
399    * </p>
400    */
401   static ListMultimap<String, TablePermission> getTablePermissions(Configuration conf,
402       byte[] tableName) throws IOException {
403     if (tableName == null) tableName = ACL_TABLE_NAME;
404 
405     // for normal user tables, we just read the table row from _acl_
406     ListMultimap<String, TablePermission> perms = ArrayListMultimap.create();
407     HTable acls = null;
408     try {
409       acls = new HTable(conf, ACL_TABLE_NAME);
410       Get get = new Get(tableName);
411       get.addFamily(ACL_LIST_FAMILY);
412       Result row = acls.get(get);
413       if (!row.isEmpty()) {
414         perms = parseTablePermissions(tableName, row);
415       } else {
416         LOG.info("No permissions found in " + ACL_TABLE_NAME_STR + " for table "
417             + Bytes.toString(tableName));
418       }
419     } finally {
420       if (acls != null) acls.close();
421     }
422 
423     return perms;
424   }

426   /**
427    * Returns the currently granted permissions for a given table as a list of
428    * user plus associated permissions.
429    */
430   static List<UserPermission> getUserPermissions(
431       Configuration conf, byte[] tableName)
432   throws IOException {
433     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> allPerms = getTablePermissions(
434       conf, tableName);
435 
436     List<UserPermission> perms = new ArrayList<UserPermission>();
437 
438     for (Map.Entry<String, TablePermission> entry : allPerms.entries()) {
439       UserPermission up = new UserPermission(Bytes.toBytes(entry.getKey()),
440           entry.getValue().getTable(), entry.getValue().getFamily(),
441           entry.getValue().getQualifier(), entry.getValue().getActions());
442       perms.add(up);
443     }
444     return perms;
445   }
446 
447   private static ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> parseTablePermissions(
448       byte[] table, Result result) {
449     ListMultimap<String,TablePermission> perms = ArrayListMultimap.create();
450     if (result != null && result.size() > 0) {
451       for (KeyValue kv : result.raw()) {
452 
453         Pair<String,TablePermission> permissionsOfUserOnTable =
454             parseTablePermissionRecord(table, kv);
455 
456         if (permissionsOfUserOnTable != null) {
457           String username = permissionsOfUserOnTable.getFirst();
458           TablePermission permissions = permissionsOfUserOnTable.getSecond();
459           perms.put(username, permissions);
460         }
461       }
462     }
463     return perms;
464   }
465 
466   private static Pair<String,TablePermission> parseTablePermissionRecord(
467       byte[] table, KeyValue kv) {
468     // return X given a set of permissions encoded in the permissionRecord kv.
469     byte[] family = kv.getFamily();
470 
471     if (!Bytes.equals(family, ACL_LIST_FAMILY)) {
472       return null;
473     }
474 
475     byte[] key = kv.getQualifier();
476     byte[] value = kv.getValue();
477     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
478       LOG.debug("Read acl: kv ["+
479                 Bytes.toStringBinary(key)+": "+
480                 Bytes.toStringBinary(value)+"]");
481     }
482 
483     // check for a column family appended to the key
484     // TODO: avoid the string conversion to make this more efficient
485     String username = Bytes.toString(key);
486     int idx = username.indexOf(ACL_KEY_DELIMITER);
487     byte[] permFamily = null;
488     byte[] permQualifier = null;
489     if (idx > 0 && idx < username.length()-1) {
490       String remainder = username.substring(idx+1);
491       username = username.substring(0, idx);
492       idx = remainder.indexOf(ACL_KEY_DELIMITER);
493       if (idx > 0 && idx < remainder.length()-1) {
494         permFamily = Bytes.toBytes(remainder.substring(0, idx));
495         permQualifier = Bytes.toBytes(remainder.substring(idx+1));
496       } else {
497         permFamily = Bytes.toBytes(remainder);
498       }
499     }
500 
501     return new Pair<String,TablePermission>(
502         username, new TablePermission(table, permFamily, permQualifier, value));
503   }

505   /**
506    * Writes a set of permissions as {@link org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable} instances
507    * to the given output stream.
508    * @param out
509    * @param perms
510    * @param conf
511    * @throws IOException
512    */
513   public static void writePermissions(DataOutput out,
514       ListMultimap<String,? extends Permission> perms, Configuration conf)
515   throws IOException {
516     Set<String> keys = perms.keySet();
517     out.writeInt(keys.size());
518     for (String key : keys) {
519       Text.writeString(out, key);
520       HbaseObjectWritable.writeObject(out, perms.get(key), List.class, conf);
521     }
522   }
523 
524   /**
525    * Writes a set of permissions as {@link org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable} instances
526    * and returns the resulting byte array.
527    */
528   public static byte[] writePermissionsAsBytes(
529       ListMultimap<String,? extends Permission> perms, Configuration conf) {
530     try {
531       ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
532       writePermissions(new DataOutputStream(bos), perms, conf);
533       return bos.toByteArray();
534     } catch (IOException ioe) {
535       // shouldn't happen here
536       LOG.error("Error serializing permissions", ioe);
537     }
538     return null;
539   }
540 
541   /**
542    * Reads a set of permissions as {@link org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable} instances
543    * from the input stream.
544    */
545   public static <T extends Permission> ListMultimap<String,T> readPermissions(
546       DataInput in, Configuration conf) throws IOException {
547     ListMultimap<String,T> perms = ArrayListMultimap.create();
548     int length = in.readInt();
549     for (int i=0; i<length; i++) {
550       String user = Text.readString(in);
551       List<T> userPerms =
552           (List)HbaseObjectWritable.readObject(in, conf);
553       perms.putAll(user, userPerms);
554     }
555 
556     return perms;
557   }

559   /**
560    * Returns whether or not the given name should be interpreted as a group
561    * principal.  Currently this simply checks if the name starts with the
562    * special group prefix character ("@").
563    */
564   public static boolean isGroupPrincipal(String name) {
565     return name != null && name.startsWith(GROUP_PREFIX);
566   }
567 
568   /**
569    * Returns the actual name for a group principal (stripped of the
570    * group prefix).
571    */
572   public static String getGroupName(String aclKey) {
573     if (!isGroupPrincipal(aclKey)) {
574       return aclKey;
575     }
576 
577     return aclKey.substring(GROUP_PREFIX.length());
578   }
